post.summary: ListController queries the Controller table using prefix and range queries against defined indexes.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ListControllerRequest is the StateQuery/ListControllerRequest request type.

key.description:
key is a value returned in PageResponse.next_key to begin
querying the next page most efficiently. Only one of offset or key
should be set.

offset.description:
offset is a numeric offset that can be used when key is unavailable.
It is less efficient than using key. Only one of offset or key should
be set.

limit.description:
limit is the total number of results to be returned in the result page.
If left empty it will default to a value to be set by each app.

count_total.description:
count_total is set to true  to indicate that the result set should include
a count of the total number of items available for pagination in UIs.
count_total is only respected when offset is used. It is ignored when key
is set.

reverse.description:
reverse is set to true if results are to be returned in the descending order.

Since: cosmos-sdk 0.43

cosmos.base.query.v1beta1.PageRequest.title:
PageRequest is to be embedded in gRPC request messages for efficient
pagination. Ex:

next_key.description:
next_key is the key to be passed to PageRequest.key to
query the next page most efficiently. It will be empty if
there are no more results.

total.title:
total is total number of results available if PageRequest.count_total
was set, its value is undefined otherwise

sonrhq.sonr.identity.module.v1.Account.description: Account is the root sonr account table which contains all sub-identities.

sonrhq.sonr.identity.module.v1.Accumulat.description:
Identifier is a psuedo-anonomyous representation of a unique id on the Sonr blockchain. Used as
authorizer to the underlying wallet interface.

sonrhq.sonr.identity.module.v1.Blockchai.title: Blockchain is the configuration table for connected blockchains

sonrhq.sonr.identity.module.v1.CoinType.description:
CoinType is the BIP-0044 coin type for each supported coin.

 - COIN_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Bitcoins coin type is 0
 - COIN_TYPE_ATOM: Testnet coin type is 1
 - COIN_TYPE_AXELAR: Litecoin coin type is 2
 - COIN_TYPE_BITCOIN: Dogecoin coin type is 3
 - COIN_TYPE_ETHEREUM: Ethereum coin type is 60
 - COIN_TYPE_EVMOS: Sonr coin type is 703
 - COIN_TYPE_FILECOIN: Cosmos coin type is 118
 - COIN_TYPE_JUNO: Filecoin coin type is 461
 - COIN_TYPE_OSMO: Handshake coin type is 5353
 - COIN_TYPE_SOLANA: Solana coin type is 501
 - COIN_TYPE_SONR: Ripple coin type is 144
 - COIN_TYPE_STARGAZE: Stargaze coin type is 1001

sonrhq.sonr.identity.module.v1.Controlle.description: Controller is the root sonr controller table which contains all sub-identities.

prefix_query.description: prefix_query specifies the index key value to use for the prefix query.

range_query.description: range_query specifies the index key from/to values to use for the range query.

sonrhq.sonr.identity.module.v1.ListAccou.description: ListAccountRequest is the StateQuery/ListAccountRequest request type.

sequence.description: sequence specifies the value of the Sequence index key to use in the query.

address.description: address specifies the value of the Address index key to use in the query.

public_key.description: public_key specifies the value of the PublicKey index key to use in the query.

sonrhq.sonr.identity.module.v1.ListAccou.description: IndexKey specifies the value of an index key to use in prefix and range queries.

address.description:
address is the value of the address field in the index.
It can be omitted to query for all valid values of that field in this segment of the index.

public_key.description:
public_key is the value of the public_key field in the index.
It can be omitted to query for all valid values of that field in this segment of the index.

sequence.description:
sequence is the value of the sequence field in the index.
It can be omitted to query for all valid values of that field in this segment of the index.

from.description:
from is the index key to use for the start of the range query.
To query from the start of an index, specify an index key for that index with empty values.

to.description:
to is the index key to use for the end of the range query.
The index key type MUST be the same as the index key type used for from.
To query from to the end of an index it can be omitted.

sonrhq.sonr.identity.module.v1.ListAccou.description: RangeQuery specifies the from/to index keys for a range query.

values.description: values are the results of the query.

sonrhq.sonr.identity.module.v1.ListAccou.description: ListAccountResponse is the StateQuery/ListAccountResponse response type.
